com.yantra.api.ydm

Interface confirmShipment

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YDMApi, YIFApi

    public interface confirmShipment

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document confirmShipment(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The confirmShipment is used to confirm a Shipment and ship the order lines.

    • Method Detail

      • confirmShipment

        org.w3c.dom.Document confirmShipment(YFSEnvironment env,
                                     org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                              throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                     java.rmi.RemoteException

        The confirmShipment is used to confirm a Shipment and ship the order lines. It can also be used to create a Shipment and immediately confirm it.

        The confirmShipment API performs one of the following transactions based on the Action attribute of the input.

        • If the value of \Shipment\Action is Create, then the TransactionId is CREATE_CONFIRM_SHIPMENT.
        • Otherwise, the TransactionId is CONFIRM_SHIPMENT.
        This TransactionID is used to raise the ON_SUCCESS event.

        In addition to these transactions related to the shipment pipeline, there are transactions conditionally performed on the order pipeline.

        • If the shipment is created and confirmed in a single call to the confirmShipment API, then the transaction executed on the order pipeline is SHIP_ORDER. The confirmShipment API can be used to ship orders in created or reserved statuses, if the SHIP_ORDER transaction is configured to support this. Therefore, it is not necessary to release an order before shipping it.
        • If an existing shipment is confirmed in a call to the confirmShipment API, then the following transactions are executed on the order pipeline:
          • If a quantity is being added to the shipment, then the order pipeline transaction INCLUDE_SHIPMENT is used to include these lines to the Shipment.
          • If a quantity is being removed from the shipment, then REMOVE_SHIPMENT transaction is used to remove these lines from the Shipment.
          • SHIP_SHIPMENT, which typically has base status 3350 on the order pipeline, is used to change the order status to Shipped.


        For shipment lines containing catch weight items if net weight is not given, it will be defaulted as,

        • If the item is containerized and container net weight is not given, shipment line net weight will be defaulted from order line.
        • If the item is containerized and container net weight is given, shipment line net weight will be calculated.
          • Example as follows,
              The Shipment has the lines
              • Item1 for U1 Units, unit weight (from orderline/catalog) is W1 Wt.
              • Item2 for U2 Units, unit weight (from orderline/catalog) is W2 Wt.
              The Shipment has the containers
                Container1 with Container1Wt weight and
                • Container1 has U1 Units of Item1
                • Container1 has U2 Units of Item2
                Container2 with Container2Wt weight and
                • Container2 has U1 Units of Item1
                • Container2 has U2 Units of Item2
              The Net Weights computed for the Shipment Lines will be
              • Item1 Net Weight = (Container1Wt) * (Container1 U1 Units * W1) * / (Container1 U1 Units *W1 + Container1 U2 Units *W2) + (Container2Wt) * (Container2 U1 Units * W1) * / (Container2 U1 Units *W1 + Container2 U2 Units *W2)
              • Item2 Net Weight = (Container1Wt) * (Container1 U2 Units * W2) * / (Container1 U1 Units *W1 + Container1 U2 Units *W2) + (Container2Wt) * (Container2 U2 Units * W2) * / (Container2 U1 Units *W1 + Container2 U2 Units *W2)

      Shipment Lines containing kit items has to be containerized with component details before confirming the shipment.
      The confirmShipment API calls the changeShipment, so for all the other validations, refer to the changeShipment

      In case of Outbound Shipments If Resource Planning is enabled for the ShipNode, all the incomplete planned tasks are completed upon confirmation of the shipment.

      Related Documents
      Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

      User Exits: This API invokes the following user exit:
      com.yantra.ydm.japi.ue.YDMBeforeCreateShipment
      com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetTagNoUE
      com.yantra.ydm.japi.ue.YDMCanShipmentBeProcessedUE
      com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetOverriddenOveragePercentageUE

      Events Raised:

      Events raised during tranaction CONFIRM_SHIPMENT

        ON_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS_CHANGE:
          This event is raised when an order release status is changed for the order.
          Data published - YFS_ORDER_CHANGE.ON_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS_CHANGE.xml
          Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt
          Template Support:
          Yes
        ON_SUCCESS:
          Data Published - YDM_CONFIRM_SHIPMENT.ON_SUCCESS.html, YDM_CONFIRM_SHIPMENT.ON_SUCCESS_dtd.txt
          Key data - shipment_dbd.txt

        Template Support: Yes

      Events raised during tranaction CREATE_CONFIRM_SHIPMENT

        ON_SUCCESS:
          Data Published - YDM_CREATE_CONFIRM_SHIPMENT.ON_SUCCESS.html, YDM_CREATE_CONFIRM_SHIPMENT.ON_SUCCESS_dtd.txt
          Key data - shipment_dbd.txt

        Template Support: Yes
        Yes. Versions: ver40 and ver45.

      Events raised during tranaction SHIP_SHIPMENT

        ON_SHIP_CONFIRM_POST_VOID:
          This event is raised when the confirmShipment API is called to confirm a shipment which includes a voided sales order.
            Data Published - YFS_SHIP_SHIPMENT.ON_SHIP_CONFIRM_POST_VOID.html, YFS_SHIP_SHIPMENT.ON_SHIP_CONFIRM_POST_VOID_dtd.txt
            Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt

          Template Support: Yes

      Events raised during tranaction SHIP_ORDER

        ON_SHIP_CONFIRM_POST_VOID:
          This event is raised when the confirmShipment API is called to create and confirm a shipment which includes a voided sales order.
            Data Published - YFS_SHIP_ORDER.ON_SHIP_CONFIRM_POST_VOID.html, YFS_SHIP_ORDER.ON_SHIP_CONFIRM_POST_VOID_dtd.txt
            Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt

          Template Support: Yes

      Events raised during tranaction REMOVE_SHIPMENT

        ON_CANCEL:
          This event is raised when the confirmShipment API is called with the CancelUnShippedQuantity flag set to Y, and quantity is cancelled off the original order as a result.
            Data Published - YFS_REMOVE_SHIPMENT.ON_CANCEL.html, YFS_REMOVE_SHIPMENT.ON_CANCEL_dtd.txt
            Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt

          Template Support: Yes

      Events raised during transaction INVENTORY_CHANGE

        ON_CHANGE:
        For more info, see the associated
          Data Published - INVENTORY_CHANGE_INVENTORY_CHANGE_dbd.txt

      Events raised during transaction INVENTORY_VALUE_CHANGE

        INVENTORY_VALUE_CHANGE:
          When a sales order is shipped this event is raised from inventory management for each order line with the inventory value change information for the fulfillment location.
            Data Published - YDM_CONFIRM_SHIPMENT.INVENTORY_VALUE_CHANGE.html, INVENTORY_CHANGE_INVENTORY_CHANGE_dbd.txt

      Events raised during transaction CHANGE_GLOBAL_SERIAL

        LEFT_NODE:
          When a sales order is shipped this event is raised from warehouse inventory management for each serial that leaves the node.
            Data Published - INV_CHANGE_GLOBAL_SERIAL.LEFT_NODE.html,

      The following events are supported only for versions ver40 and ver45:

        CREATE_CONFIRM_SHIPMENT/PUBLISH_SHIP_CONFIRM
        For details on the output, refer to the XML and DTD output files.
        CREATE_CONFIRM_SHIPMENT/CANCEL_SHIPMENT
        For details on the output, refer to the XML and DTD files.
        CREATE_CONFIRM_SHIPMENT/ON_FAILURE
        For details on the output, refer to the XML and DTD files.

    Audits:
    YFS_SHIPMENT_STATUS_AUDIT record is written indicating the from and to (SHIPPED) status change.

    Pre-conditions: None

    Post-conditions: None

    Output Template Support: Yes

    Database Extensibility Support:Yes

Parameters:
env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

Returns:
An XML document that contains all the information about the container. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

Throws:
com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
